H0.text: What is a nervous disorder whereby a person suddenly falls asleep. Hypersomnia

H1.text: What is a nervous disorder whereby a person suddenly falls asleep. Somnolence

H2.text: What is a nervous disorder whereby a person suddenly falls asleep. Insomnia-Related Fatigue

H3.text: What is a nervous disorder whereby a person suddenly falls asleep. Narcelepsy

A4.text: Narcolepsy is a chronic neurological disorder that impairs the ability to regulate sleepâ€“wake cycles, and specifically impacts REM (rapid eye movement) sleep.

A5.text: The classic symptoms of the disorder, often referred to as the 'tetrad of narcolepsy', are cataplexy, sleep paralysis, hypnagogic hallucinations, and excessive daytime sleepiness.
